Ubuntu! |publisher=Whois.domaintools.com |date= |accessdate=2011-05-25}}</ref> | current status = Online | revenue = | alexa = {{increase}} 11,947 ({{as of|2011|11|2|alt=November 2011}})<ref name="alexa">{{cite web|url= http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/omgubuntu.co.uk |title= Omgubuntu.co.uk Site Info | publisher= [[Alexa Internet]] |accessdate= 2011-11-02 }}</ref><!--Updated monthly by OKBot.--> | footnotes = }}
'''OMG! Ubuntu!''' is a [[Linux]] review blog that was launched in August 2009, that provides reviews, developments and updates about [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] and its derivatives. The website is part of the Ohso Ltd Network.<ref name="aboutomg">{{cite web|url=http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/about/ |title=About OMG! Ubuntu! |publisher=omgubuntu.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-05-25}}</ref> Its main focus is average Ubuntu users, rather than developers.
The site was registered on September 2, 2009, <ref name="whois" /> although it had existed prior to this date at another URL.{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}} Editor-in-Chief Joey-Elijah Sneddon reported in late May 2011 that OMG! Ubuntu! receives 3 million page views per month.<ref>Sneddon, Joey-Elijah [https://twitter.com/#!/d0od/status/72957438852214784 Twitter Announcement] 24 May 2011</ref>
While initially based on [[Blogger (service)|Blogger]], the site now employs [[WordPress]] blog software, with a custom theme<ref name="design">{{cite web|url=http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2010/09/designing-the-new-omg-ubuntu-site/ |title=Designing the new OMG! Ubuntu! site |publisher=omgubuntu.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-05-28}}</ref> designed by Ohso's co-owner and OMG! Ubuntu! writer Benjamin Humphrey and various custom built widgets and plugins.
== Format == The site primarily provides blog-style updates about [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] news as well as interviews with key people in the Linux community, such as [[Jono Bacon]], [[Linus Torvalds]], and [[Jeff Waugh]].<ref name="baconinterview">{{cite web|url=http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2010/08/omg-interviews-jono-bacon/ |title=OMG! Interviews: Jono Bacon |publisher=omgubuntu.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-05-28}}</ref><ref name="torvaldsinterview">{{cite web|url=http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/01/our-exclusive-interview-with-linus-torvalds-lca2011/ |title=Our exclusive interview with Linus Torvalds |publisher=omgubuntu.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-05-28}}</ref><ref name="waughinterview">{{cite web|url=http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/01/lca2011-interview-%E2%80%93-ex-canonical-jeff-waugh-talks-beginnings-of-ubuntu-unity-gnome/ |title=LCA2011 Interview: ex-Canonical Jeff Waugh talks beginnings of Ubuntu; Unity, GNOME |publisher=omgubuntu.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-05-28}}</ref>
The site has a degree of integration with [[Ask Ubuntu]], by including high-ranking questions and information from the site.<ref name="omghome">{{cite web|url=http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk |title=OMG! Ubuntu! |publisher=omgubuntu.co.uk |date= |accessdate=30 May 2011}}</ref>
In April 2011, to celebrate the release of [[Ubuntu 11.04]] and as a response to the confusion surrounding the introduction of the [[Unity (user interface)|Unity interface]], the site launched an interactive guide to help new users.<ref name="nattyguide">{{cite web|url=http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/natty |title=OMG! Ubuntu!'s guide to Unity in 11.04 |publisher=omgubuntu.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-05-28}}</ref>
== Other products == The OMG! Ubuntu! website has also released a [[commercial software]] game for the Ubuntu platform called ''Volley Brawl'', available through the [[Ubuntu Software Centre]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/03/volley-brawl-released-into-software-center-for-maverick-natty/ |title=Volley Brawl released into Software Center for Maverick, Natty for $2.99 (Update: Now with more gameplay video!) |publisher=Omgubuntu.co.uk |date=2011-03-30 |accessdate=2011-05-28}}</ref>
A free [[Android (operating system)|Android]] application for viewing the website is available.<ref>{{cite web|last=Eamon |first=Thierry |url=https://market.android.com/details?id=com.echo.omgubuntu&feature=search_result |title=OMG! Ubuntu! - Android Market |publisher=Market.android.com |date= |accessdate=2011-05-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/05/introducing-the-omg-ubuntu-android-app/ |title=Introducing the OMG! Ubuntu! Android app |publisher=Omgubuntu.co.uk |date=2011-05-01 |accessdate=2011-05-28}}</ref>
